result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad W. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad W. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Cases called: 22CM314 And 22CM368. Defendant Chad W. Johnson in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. There is an agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM314: Misd Battery and Count 1 in 22CM368: Misd Battery. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders:
2 days jail on each count with 2 days of jail credit in each count.
court costs and surcharges
DNA sample and surcharge.

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.

Judge Jon Theisen for Branch 2 Intake. 10:11 cases 22CM314, 22CM368 called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad W. Johnson in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to counsel and is advised to complete paperwork with the District Attorney's office to waive counsel. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/10/2022 1:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:29 AM cases 22CM314 and 22CM368 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad W. Johnson in court without counsel. 
Defendant is trying to retain an attorney. Defendant provided copies of the criminal complaints in both files. 
10:36 AM recalled. Same appearances. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/29/22 at 1:15 PM. 
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant intends to hire Attorney Scott Schlough.
Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with victims S.C., G.N.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
(Covers 22CM314 & 22CM368)

(11:11 AM cases 22CM314, 22CM368 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad W. Johnson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Chad W. Johnson.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaints.
Defendant didn't apply with Public Defender Office for representation. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.

Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
